declarations.comments:
A Strom is a stream of values that can:
- Emit zero or more values of type `a`
- Fail with errors tracked in the `err` row
- Require a context `ctx`
- Perform effects in Om

Think of it as: `Om ctx err (Array a)` but lazy and chunked

The Step type is interpreted as:
- Loop (chunk, next) => emit chunk (if present) and continue with next
- Done finalChunk => emit final chunk (if present) and stop
declarations.title: Strom

declarations.comments: An empty stream
declarations.title: empty

declarations.comments: A stream with a single element
declarations.title: succeed

declarations.comments: A stream that fails immediately with an empty result (no error thrown)
declarations.title: fail

declarations.comments: Create a stream from an Aff computation
declarations.title: fromAff

declarations.comments: Create a stream from an Om computation
declarations.title: fromOm

declarations.comments: Create a stream from an array
declarations.title: fromArray

declarations.comments: Create a stream from any foldable
declarations.title: fromFoldable

declarations.comments: Create a stream of integers in a range [start, end)
declarations.title: rangeStrom

declarations.comments:
Iterate producing values - limited to ~10,000 elements for stack safety
For truly infinite streams, use `iterateStromInfinite` (with Aff overhead)
declarations.title: iterateStrom

declarations.comments:
Truly infinite iteration - stack-safe via Aff async boundaries
Adds tiny delay (0ms) at each chunk to reset the stack
Use this when you need more than 10k elements
declarations.title: iterateStromInfinite

declarations.comments: Repeat a value - limited to ~10,000 elements for stack safety
declarations.title: repeatStrom

declarations.comments:
Truly infinite repeat - stack-safe via Aff async boundaries
Adds tiny delay (0ms) at each chunk to reset the stack
declarations.title: repeatStromInfinite

declarations.comments:
Repeat an Om computation - limited to 100 iterations for stack safety
For truly infinite repetition, use `repeatOmStromInfinite` (with Aff overhead)
declarations.title: repeatOmStrom

declarations.comments:
Truly infinite Om repetition - stack-safe via Aff async boundaries
Adds tiny delay (0ms) at each pull to reset the stack
declarations.title: repeatOmStromInfinite

declarations.comments:
Unfold a stream from a seed value - can be infinite if f never returns Nothing
Emits chunks lazily, terminates when f returns Nothing
declarations.title: unfoldStrom

declarations.comments: Unfold a stream with an effectful function
declarations.title: unfoldOmStrom

declarations.comments: Collect all elements into an array (O(n) using chunk accumulation)
declarations.title: runCollect

declarations.comments: Run the stream and discard all elements
declarations.title: runDrain

declarations.comments: Fold over all elements
declarations.title: runFold

declarations.comments: Traverse the stream with effects, discarding results
declarations.title: traverseStrom_

declarations.comments: Alias for traverseStrom_ with arguments flipped
declarations.title: forStrom_

declarations.comments: Alias for traverseStrom_ (FP convention)
declarations.title: forMStrom_

declarations.comments: Alias for traverseStrom_ (explicit monadic naming)
declarations.title: traverseMStrom_

declarations.comments: Map over elements
declarations.title: mapStrom

declarations.comments: Map with a monadic effect
declarations.title: mapMStrom

declarations.comments:
Bind for streams (monadic flatMap/chain)
Use >>= operator for cleaner syntax: `stream >>= f`
declarations.title: bindStrom

declarations.comments: Scan with accumulator (like foldl but emits intermediate results)
declarations.title: scanStrom

declarations.comments: Map with accumulator (stateful map)
declarations.title: mapAccumStrom

declarations.comments: Tap (observe without modifying)
declarations.title: tapStrom

declarations.comments: Tap with monadic effect (observe with effects)
declarations.title: tapMStrom

declarations.comments: Filter elements
declarations.title: filterStrom

declarations.comments: Take n elements (with proper state tracking across chunks)
declarations.title: takeStrom

declarations.comments: Take while predicate is true
declarations.title: takeWhileStrom

declarations.comments: Take until predicate is true (includes the matching element)
declarations.title: takeUntilStrom

declarations.comments: Drop n elements (with proper state tracking across chunks)
declarations.title: dropStrom

declarations.comments: Drop while predicate is true
declarations.title: dropWhileStrom

declarations.comments: Filter with monadic predicate
declarations.title: filterMStrom

declarations.comments: Collect with partial function (mapMaybe)
declarations.title: collectStrom

declarations.comments: Collect with monadic partial function
declarations.title: collectMStrom

declarations.comments: Remove consecutive duplicates
declarations.title: changesStrom

declarations.comments: Group elements into fixed-size arrays
declarations.title: groupedStrom

declarations.comments: Alias for groupedStrom
declarations.title: chunkedStrom

declarations.comments:
Group consecutive elements by a key function
Emits groups when the key changes
declarations.title: groupByStrom

declarations.comments:
Partition a stream by a predicate into two separate operations
Returns a tuple of (trues, falses)
Note: This requires running the stream twice, so it's not lazy
declarations.title: partition

declarations.comments: Partition and map in one pass
declarations.title: partitionMap

declarations.comments:
Debounce a stream - adds a delay after each element
Useful for rate-limiting or giving downstream time to process
declarations.title: debounce

declarations.comments:
Throttle a stream - emit at most once per duration period
Tracks last emission time and skips elements that arrive too quickly
Note: Uses wall-clock time, not processing time
declarations.title: throttle

declarations.comments: Delay each element by a duration
declarations.title: delayStrom

declarations.comments:
Run a stream in the background, returning a Fiber that can be cancelled

To use cancellable streams, convert your stream to Om and use Om.launchOm:

Example:
```purescript
fiber <- Om.launchOm ctx handlers (Strom.runCollect myStream)
-- ... later ...
killFiber (error "Cancelled") fiber
```

Or for subscription-style:
```purescript
fiber <- Om.launchOm ctx handlers (Strom.traverseStrom_ callback myStream)
-- ... later ...  
killFiber (error "Unsubscribed") fiber
```

Note: You can use Om.launchOm directly with any Om-returning function like:
- `runCollect` - collect results in background
- `runDrain` - run for side effects
- `traverseStrom_` - process each element with callback
- `runFold` - fold with accumulator
Append two streams
Now properly handles multi-chunk streams with new Step protocol
Note: s2 is appended TO s1 (s1 comes first, then s2)
This matches pipeline semantics: stream # appendStrom other means stream followed by other
declarations.title: appendStrom

declarations.comments:
Concatenate an array of streams
Uses foldr with flip to match appendStrom's pipeline-friendly parameter order
declarations.title: concatStrom

declarations.comments: Zip two streams together
declarations.title: zipStrom

declarations.comments: Zip two streams with a function
declarations.title: zipWithStrom

declarations.comments:
Interleave two streams - alternates between elements from each stream
Similar to merge but deterministic - always alternates
declarations.title: interleave

declarations.comments: Intersperse a separator element between each element of the stream
declarations.title: intersperse

declarations.comments: Merge termination strategy (like ZStream HaltStrategy)
declarations.title: HaltStrategy

declarations.comments:
Merge two streams concurrently (nondeterministic like ZStream merge)
Elements are emitted as soon as they're available from either stream
declarations.title: merge

declarations.comments: Merge multiple streams concurrently
declarations.title: mergeAll

declarations.comments: Merge with halt strategy and mapping functions (ZStream-like)
declarations.title: mergeWith

declarations.comments:
Non-deterministic merge: Merge two streams concurrently, emitting elements as soon as they're available
Unlike `merge`, this runs both streams in parallel and elements may arrive in any order
The stream that produces results faster will have its elements appear first
Optimized: Spawns producer fibers once and uses a queue for communication
declarations.title: mergeND

declarations.comments: Non-deterministic merge with configurable buffer capacity (chunk queue)
declarations.title: mergeNDWith

declarations.comments:
Non-deterministic merge of multiple streams
All streams run concurrently and emit elements as soon as they're available
declarations.title: mergeAllND

declarations.comments: Non-deterministic merge of multiple streams with configurable buffer capacity
declarations.title: mergeAllNDWith

declarations.comments:
Race two streams - returns elements from whichever produces first
Uses Om.race for true concurrent racing
declarations.title: race

declarations.comments: Race multiple streams - returns elements from whichever produces first
declarations.title: raceAll

declarations.comments:
Map over elements in parallel with bounded concurrency
Processes chunks in parallel groups up to the concurrency limit
declarations.title: mapPar

declarations.comments: Alias for mapPar with explicit "M" naming
declarations.title: mapMPar

declarations.comments: For each element, execute an effect in parallel with bounded concurrency
declarations.title: foreachPar

declarations.comments: Unordered parallel map (currently same as mapPar)
declarations.title: mapParUnordered

declarations.comments: Alias for unordered mapPar with explicit "M" naming
declarations.title: mapMParUnordered

declarations.comments: Unordered parallel foreach
declarations.title: foreachParUnordered

declarations.comments: Buffer stream elements with backpressure (destroys chunking)
declarations.title: buffer

declarations.comments: Buffer stream chunks with backpressure (preserves chunking)
declarations.title: bufferChunks

declarations.comments:
Catch all errors and recover with a handler function
Note: Uses handleErrors' for full error handling
declarations.title: catchAll

declarations.comments: Retry a stream on failure up to 3 times
declarations.title: retry

declarations.comments: Retry a stream N times on failure
declarations.title: retryN

declarations.comments:
Add a timeout to stream operations
If the stream doesn't complete within the duration, it terminates as empty
declarations.title: timeout

declarations.comments: Run a finaliser after the stream completes (success or failure)
declarations.title: ensuring

declarations.comments:
Bracket pattern: acquire, use, release
Guarantees release runs even if stream fails
declarations.title: bracket

declarations.comments: Bracket with exit information (whether stream succeeded or failed)
declarations.title: bracketExit

declarations.comments: Simplified acquire-release pattern
declarations.title: acquireRelease

declarations.comments: Helper to create a Strom from a pull function
declarations.title: mkStrom

declarations.comments: Helper to unwrap a Strom
declarations.title: runStrom
